snippet: Copper brake pads produce metal dust that environmental advocates say reaches waterways and harms aquatic life.
abstract: Copper brake pads produce metal dust that environmental advocates say reaches waterways and harms aquatic life.
lead_paragraph: Government at the state and federal levels has been preoccupied with improving the fuel economy of the nation's fleet. Smaller environmental causes are also in the mix, including mercury in car switches and lead weights used to balance auto wheels.

headline.main: Movement to Banish Copper From Brake Pads Gains Momentum
